result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest R Lee-Knutson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 15CF577 with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing to ensure abstinence

No Contact with V.C. or B.H.;  Any other No Contact issues are left up to the PO's discretion
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge indicated in 15CF577

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 30 days if probation is ever revoked

Probation can be extended for a year if necessary

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Forrest R Lee-Knutson
